I

IEngineInterface<GameType> - Interface in github.lightningcreations.lcjei
Class Representing an Interface to a Game Engine that runs games of a specified type.
Provided a way to access this Interface is the minimum requirements for Compliance with the Lightning Creations Java Game Interface Specification.
This Interface makes it possible for game engines to delegate to other game engines, wrap games from other engines, or even embed games from other engines to other games.
IGameInfo<GameType> - Interface in github.lightningcreations.lcjei
Class that represents information about a Game.
initialize(Container) - Method in interface github.lightningcreations.lcjei.IEngineInterface
Initializes the Engine referenced by this Interface.
The Engine is requested, though not strictly required, to render the graphical output to Component.
If c is null, has the same effect as IEngineInterface.initialize().
This may not be called after a call to initialize, unless a subsequent call to destroy has been made.
initialize() - Method in interface github.lightningcreations.lcjei.IEngineInterface
Initializes the Engine in an Implementation-Specific manner.
Usually the drawing pane is a frame created by the implementation.
This method may not be called after it or IEngineInterface.initialize(Container) succesfully returns, until a call to destroy() sucessfully returns.
initialize(Container) - Method in class github.lightningcreations.lcjei.wrapper.WrappedEngine
 
initialize() - Method in class github.lightningcreations.lcjei.wrapper.WrappedEngine
Initializes the guest to draw to the host's current draw container as though by {WrappedEngine.initialize(Container).
